content.description: Fun alternative to Supply Line. Start off the second belay ledge of SL and meander to the right. After a few bolts, you'll meet a right facing corner to overlap then a mildly spicy runout to anchors (Commander Ledge). 3 stars.
content.location: Just to the right of Supply Line (2nd pitch) on Not so Grassy Ledge.

content.description: Consistent climbing on high quality stone at a moderate grade make for fun climbing past the namesake feature of stone on the route. The broken blocks you'll reluctantly need to step on with your left foot at the start of the route are the only thing to detract from the fine stone above.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a bolted rap anchor
content.location:
On the far right end of

Not So Grassy Ledge

is a bolted belay. Three bolted lines depart above you, Randall Handle is the left most line of bolts.

climbs.name: Napoleon
climbs.fa: Randy Levitt, Chris Hubbard, Jeff Pierce

content.description: Follows the black streak up the main head wall, just to the left of The Commander. Interesting and fun moves over a bulge then onto a steep aesthetic orange face. Crimp and power your way up and through the crux. A classic. Great to link it up with Tears of Envy.
content.location: To the left of Commander's 4th pitch. (left side of Command Center ledge)
